revised_title: The Origin of Pearls: A Study by Christophorus Sandius
tldr: Christophorus Sandius shares his findings on the origin of pearls, detailing their formation in oysters found in sweet waters of Norway. He explains that pearls form when eggs stick to the oyster and grow into pearls, leaving a mark on both the fish and shell. Sandius also mentions the credibility of his findings, based on the testimony of a Dane, Henricus Arnoldi, and the likelihood of the process.
